qas.question: What was the most frequently used transistor in the 1960s and 70s?

answers.text: their greater linearity and ease of manufacture

qas.question: What are some applications of discrete MOSFETs?

answers.text: transistor applications, including analog circuits, voltage regulators, amplifiers, power transmitters and motor drivers

qas.question: What were the most popular digital circuits of the time?
When did MOSFETs become widely available?
What are the desirable properties of MOSFETs?
What was the most common application of MOSFETs?
Which type of circuit is older?
What kind of circuit is used more in the present?

context: The <a0_0>bipolar junction transistor<a0_0/> (BJT) was the most commonly used transistor in <b4_0>the 1960s<b4_0/> and 70s. Even after MOSFETs became widely available, the BJT remained the transistor of choice for many <b7_0>analog circuits<b7_0/> such as amplifiers because of <a1_0>their greater linearity and <b5_0>ease of manufacture<b5_0/><a1_0/>. In integrated circuits, the desirable properties of <a3_0>MOSFETs<a3_0/> allowed them to capture nearly all market share for <b8_0>digital circuits<b8_0/>. Discrete MOSFETs can be applied in <a2_0>transistor applications, including analog circuits, voltage regulators, <b6_0>amplifiers<b6_0/>, power transmitters and motor drivers<a2_0/>.
